title: Bug 102516 - JDBC Data Set Editor should load tables and columns on demand
description:
Bug 102516 - JDBC Data Set Editor should load tables and columns on demand

The JDBC Data Set Editor page for a SQL Query has a tree control that lists the tables and columns in your data source. On the iSeries platform using the JTOpen JDBC drivers, this tree control shows every schema (aka catalog) on the system. This is easily several hundred tables. Using the code in CVS from 6/30/05, I see the schema filter; however, I still have the warning message on load since the tree is being populated on load.

When the data set editor is opened, you have to wait while the entire schema is queried, and eventually get the 'Only 500 items can be viewed in the available list...' message. Bug 101372 asks for the ability to filter based on schema.
OB: On the iSeries platform using the JTOpen JDBC drivers, the JDBC Data Set Editor's tree control shows every schema (aka catalog) on the system even if there are several hundred tables. The schema filter is present, but a warning message is displayed on load as the tree is being populated on load.
EB: The JDBC Data Set Editor should load tables and columns on demand instead of loading all schemas and tables on load. It should not display the warning message or have the limitation of only displaying 500 items in the available list.
SR: To reproduce, open the data set editor and observe that the entire schema is queried on load. Wait for the 'Only 500 items can be viewed in the available list...' message to appear.
